etymology.description: 想(想) (xiǎng, "think") combined with 象(像) (xiàng, "image") to express the concept of forming mental images or envisioning something in the mind.
etymology.interpretation: The word 想象(想像) (xiǎngxiàng, "imagination; imagine") brings together the concepts of thinking and forming images, conveying the idea of creating or conceiving mental pictures.

examples.chinese: 他喜欢想象未来(他喜歡想像未來)，描绘梦想蓝图(描繪夢想藍圖)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xǐhuān xiǎngxiàng wèilái, miáohuì mèngxiǎng lántú.
examples.english: He enjoys imagining the future and sketching a blueprint of his dreams.

examples.chinese: 孩子们沉浸在故事里(孩子們沉浸在故事裡)，尽情想象奇妙世界(盡情想像奇妙世界)。
examples.pinyin: Háizimen chénjìn zài gùshì lǐ, jìnqíng xiǎngxiàng qímiào shìjiè.
examples.english: Children are immersed in stories and unabashedly imagine a magical world.

examples.chinese: 夜深人静时(夜深人靜時)，他常在心中想象童年时光(他常在心中想像童年時光)。
examples.pinyin: Yè shēn rénjìng shí, tā cháng zài xīnzhōng xiǎngxiàng tóngnián shíguāng.
examples.english: When the night is deep and quiet, he often imagines the times of his childhood in his heart.
